meanings.definition: To revoke or cancel (an agreement or decision)
meanings.sent1: The company was rescinding the contract due to new information.
meanings.sent2: The government is rescinding the law to make changes.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked about rescinding the homework assignment, but the students knew it was serious.
meanings.sent4: She felt like rescinding her promise was like erasing a mistake.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gavel resonated in the courtroom, symbolizing the rescinding of the previous ruling.

meanings.definition: The act of rescinding or revoking something
meanings.sent1: The rescinding of the agreement caused confusion among the parties involved.
meanings.sent2: His rescinding of the invitation surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The rescinding of the movie ticket made him realize he had the wrong one.
meanings.sent4: The rescinding of the award left her feeling disappointed and puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The rescinding of the decision echoed through the halls, leaving a sense of uncertainty.
